column4: if i SSH to a server, and start a program like ./dothis &, how do i make sure it KEEPS RUNNING when i close the terminal i started ssh in?
The lame way is to use the "nohup" command.  The slick way is to use the "screen" command.
I usually just type "screen".  Then do whatever.  Then something crashes and I have to figure out how to reconnect -- I think "screen -r".  I'm not a screen wiz.
